text.p: These are significant stories in the Nigerian press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Central Bank Governor Paul Ogwuma tells commercial banks the government will intervene if they allow newly freed interest rates to go haywire.
- State-owned Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation invites bids for purchase of Nigerian oil refineries.
- Pinnacle Commercial Bank gets 90 days to settle its debts with the central bank or face liquidation, sources say.
- A draft energy policy for Nigeria is now awaiting approval of the head of state, General Sani Abacha, Daily Times learns.
- Some 600 vehicles donated eight months ago to the federal government by the World Bank to ease transport problems in primary and secondary schools are lying idle.
- Local council polls likely to be held on December 17, sources in the electoral comsission say.
- Nigerian Ports Plc reverts to its previous name of Nigerian Port Authority in line with government directive.
- Inflation falls by four percent in July to 44.7 percent from 48.7 percent in June, federal officie of statistics figures say.
- Nigeria donates bitumen to Burkina Faso, industry sources say.
- Value added tax overshoots target of 22 billion naira this year.
